Key Match Events: Cenk Tosun scored in stoppage time to send Turkey into the knockout stage with a 2-1 win over 10-man Czech Republic
Tomas Chory was shown a red card after a flare-up between players and substitutes
Antonin Barak was sent off in the 20th minute for a tactical foul
Jindrich Stanek left the game with an apparent shoulder injury
Post-Match Reflections: Tosun said, 'This is just the start,' expressing satisfaction with his goal
Czech coach Ivan Hasek said, 'He [Barak] was sad, with his head in his hands. He really punished himself by beating himself up about it.'
Tomas Soucek said, 'It’s disappointment. We all wanted to advance. We had a goal to beat them from the start but we didn’t make it, that’s disappointing'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Romanian referee Istvan Kovacs sent off 18 players with yellow cards
Kenan Yildiz and Hakan Calhanoglu caused serious problems for the Czech defense
Calhanoglu scored the opening goal in the 51st minute
Soucek equalized in the 66th after a goalmouth scramble
Turkish team will next face Austria in Leipzig on Tuesday
